RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 58. Claiming Purse 18000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WHY WAIT showed early natural speed as she was the first out of the gates, was quickly challenged for the lead by an inside rival, rated off the pace in hands in a stalking position, was given her head and asked after the half, responded willingly and took command, led the rest of the way, was slightly challenged by a closing foe, kept on task, and pulled away for a game win. TDZ WHAT A DEAL was racing in the second tier on the outside in the three path, stalked the early pace, angled further out in the turn, was six and seven wide in the stretch. closed but struggled to switch leads and was second best today. MY ROYAL PRINCESS was off a step slow, was allowed to find her stride while saving ground, was gaining ground by the half, shifted out into the five path and started to close in on the early pace, continued to gain ground and build momentum through the turn and into the stretch, was widest in the lane and was pushed out even further by an inside drifting foe, but closed well and ran a decent third. ASPIRATIONAL made no impact. SAVANNAH'S HERE was sent out of the one post position and pushed to gain the early lead, briefly led but was under constant pressure from an outside rival, stayed on the rail through out, gave way late. BEAUTIFULGUATEMALA raced off the pace from the two path in the second tier, was in contention early but faded late.

ENTRY.NAME: Savannah's Here
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, rail, pressured from outside, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Why Wait
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed, rated, 2w, stalked, led 7-16th, drifted out, game win

ENTRY.NAME: My Royal Princess
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slw, off pace, 3w, shifted out 5w, 8wlate, closed, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Tdz What a Deal
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, 2nd tier, stalked, angled further out 6w, drftd7w strtch, L L

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 5F Turf CR: 77. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DRAG MALIBU was the speed of the race, broke sharp and quickly took the lead and the rail, was one in front right away and willingly maintained that position gate to wire. Much the best. THE BOYZ PRIORITY was in between horses and mid pack the first few jumps out of the gate, vied for the lead, decided to stalk the early leader in the four path, stalked in that position into the stretch, was asked and encouraged, responded and chased the eventual winner to the wire and earned second place honors. STRUTTIN APRIORITY raced from the inside along the rail, was mid pack early on, was allowed to race at his pace until the half mile pole, inched out at the quarter pole and closed six wide down the lane with a mild bid. SUPER INTENSE was five wide and racing on the outside in the middle of the field, advanced and improved position after the half mile pole, raced five wide in the stretch but didn't have enough today. DIESEL FUEL raced widest of all and made no impact. PUNTO RAFFA VOLO had brief speed early, was racing five wide but showed little. PIKACHU never involved. ROCKIN TAMIM trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Struttin Apriority
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail, mid pack, 4w upper, closed, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Drag Malibu
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, veerd out stretch, still much the best

ENTRY.NAME: The Boyz Priority
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, settled, stalked, chased, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Super Intense
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5w, 2nd tier, mid pack, in hands, advanced half, improved

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 53. Maiden Special Weight Purse 30000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For A Claiming Price Of Less Than $25,000).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BITSY PERFECTMATCH settled into the middle of the field after the break while racing in the five path, raced in hands until the half mile pole, was given her cue and willingly passed rivals on the outside and took command, happily continued through the lane and was an easy winner today. LUYV raced out of the one post position, found her stride quickly, advanced up the rail behind horses, had pressure on her out side, stayed tucked in the pocket along the rail and waited for racing room, seized the opportunity and gamely passed through a hole before it closed up, accelerated into the stretch and closed up the rail, ran a bit green in deep stretch, didn't catch the winner this time but ran a game race and earned a well deserved second. LITTLE Z was off the pace was far back, raced from the four path through out, moved at the half but did have enough. BOSTON MILLIE brief speed, raced three wide, challenged from the outside, had the lead forr a few strides then faltered. JENNYSBIGBABY showed little. AFLEET CHARLENE had an awkward start, raced off the pace, made no impacat. HOLIDAY FLOWERS was never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Luyv
ENTRY.COMMENT: professional, gutzy, green in the stretch, finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Afleet Charlene
ENTRY.OWNER: Beene Linda D and Rowe Stephen

ENTRY.NAME: Little Z
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, settled in hands, 4w, advanced 1/2, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Boston Millie
ENTRY.OWNER: Schmidt Denise and High River Stables LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Bitsy Perfectmatch
ENTRY.OWNER: Reeves Kathy Eleven One Racing Stables LLC and Joe Hackler Racing LP
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 5w, settled in hands, mvd 1/2, willingly, easy winner

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 5F Dirt CR: 82. Claiming Purse 13000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE IN 2023. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. . Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TRACK SMART was racing along the rail mid pack after the break, saved ground, shifted out a the half mile marker, launched bid, circled, was four wide into the stretch, was determined and encouraged, kept closing in on the leader, gaining ground with each stride, was a few strides from the wire, was gathered up in a strong hand ride, pushed on, was able to get up for the lead in the last stride. Strong finish, hard earned win. GLENN'S JUMPER showed his speed and easily took the lead, raced from the outside, angled into the rail briefly putting one of his foes on alert, continued into the stretch and raced along the rail, was almost an uncontested winner but was caught by a fast closing outside rival and just missed. TRIPPER JOHN stalked the early pace from the two path, was just off the leader along the inside, had to steady when the eventual winner dropped down to gain better positioning, continued to drift out and was never involved after that. YES BAB off slow, saved ground. PLATINUM EQUITY showed little. PER RULING #25065 FROM THE LOUISIANA RACING COMMISSION, TRACK SMART WAS DISQUALIFIED FROM 1st TO UNPLACED DUE TO A POSITIVE TEST.

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Track Smart
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rail, angled out 4w, launched bid, circled, closed, up

ENTRY.NAME: Tripper John
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 2w, in tight, steadied, drifted out

ENTRY.NAME: Glenn's Jumper
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed his speed, lead, angled down 3w, rail stretch, just missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 1M Turf CR: 92. Allowance Purse 28000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, STATE BRED OR TRIAL OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over On The Turf Since Ap ril 28 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances). (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OH MY ACHING ARCH raced two wide, behind the early leaders, was patiently waiting for the cue, edged out at the quarter pole, improved position while racing six wide into the stretch, drew along the side of the early leaders at the sixteenth pole, was asked, responded with an explosive turn of foot and drew away willingly. HUDSON'S TURN was well off the pace, raced along the rail, saved ground throughout, advanced up the rail, and closed well. PAYNT BATTLE showed speed, stalked the leader from the outside in the four path, challenged for the lead at the three eighths pole, briefly took the lead in the stretch after the quarter pole, and tired late. DUDE DROP KID was off a touch slow, raced two wide and was never involved. BIGTIME TEGRIDY flashed early speed and raced along the rail and tired late. RUNNINGINTHEMONEY vied for the lead, led with constant pressure to the inside of him and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Hudson's Turn
ENTRY.OWNER: Bockmon Danny The Ravens Rock Farm LLC and Currey Stephen

ENTRY.NAME: Oh My Aching Arch
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 2w, behind, rated, angled 6w, battled, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Dude Drop Kid
ENTRY.OWNER: Charles C. and John Dirik, LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Paynt Battle
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed, 4w, circled ,challenged, briefly lead between calls, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 11000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ONE MORE BABY raced behind the front runners in the three path, edged out after the half, challenged from the outside at the three eighths pole, engaged in a three way battle into the furlong ground, shook the last contender and was up for the win. SHANKINSTINE went to the lead willingly along the rail, set the pace from within himself, was pressured through out by outside challengers, was joined by pressuring rivals, was in a three way battle all the way until the sixteenth pole, dug in for a few more strides before tiring. PLENTY OF CENTS vied for the lead from the four path early, settled right off of the early pace setter, inched down into the two path, advanced up next to the pace setter and was joined by another rival to his outside, engaged in a three way battle that ran from the three eighths pole all the way to the furlong ground, where PLENT OF CENTS gave way. MORO LEGEND raced behind horse in a stalking position from the two path, was pressured by an outside foe and folded. BUTWAITTHERE'SMORE missed the break and had little impact. THIRSTY WIND trailed. COUNTRY CUT was no menace.

ENTRY.NAME: Shankinstine
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, rail, had outside prssre,3 way battle 3/8, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: One More Baby
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2nd tier, 3w, improved 3/8, battled into furlong grnd, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Plenty of Cents
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed, 4w, in between, battled 3/8, gave way

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 79. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 32000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winner s Of A Race Since April 28, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GOLDEN SMILES was sharp out of the gate, settled four wide mid pack, patiently waited for the cue, was asked at the half mile pole, responded well and improved position moving in between runners, continued to close the gap as he raced down the stretch on the outside, collared the leader at the sixteenth pole, and was up in time . ZYDECO MUSIC was off a step slow, raced five wide, was asked and raced up early to join the pack, raced on the outside as she passed most of rivals through the turn, was the leader at the quarter pole, was almost home free but was collared late by a deep closer on the outside and settled for second. G'S SQUEEZE off slow, mild bid. SUMITUP early speed. INAWIC off pace, mild bid. SOPHIE'S PRAYER showed little. BRAVE CITY GIRL brief speed.

ENTRY.NAME: Zydeco Music
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, 5w, off pace, advanced quickly, circled, led 1/4,caught

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Smiles
ENTRY.COMMENT: sharp, settled, mid pack, 4w, improved 1/2 in between, closed, up

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 8 1M Turf CR: 75. Allowance Purse 28000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, STATE BRED OR TRIAL OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over O n The Turf Since April 28 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances). (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards) (Rail at2 0 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BIRDIE CALL stalked from the outside in the two path, launched a bid near the sixteenth pole, took command late and was up for the win. CLAIRE JUNE raced off the pace mid pack, from the two path, angled out a bit into the three path, advanced along the outside, closing ground, cleared the rest of the field except the eventual winner by the quarter pole, chased the leader through out and settled for second. HONORARY GUEST was settled in hands off the pace while racing two wide, improved position at the half mile pole, but sis not have enough. TAY TAY'S BABY stalked the early pace while racing along the rail, angled out five side in the stretch but to no avail. C. C. HARBOR trailed early and improved slightly while closing. SAVVY SHIPMAN was no factor. SULWE raced from the three path mid pack and had little impact. COLD NIGHT AIR vied for the early lead, attended the pace, saved ground, faltered late.

ENTRY.NAME: Honorary Guest
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled in hands off the pace, 2w, moved up rail, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Tay Tay's Baby
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, rail, mid pack, showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Claire June
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2w, mid pack, one run, 3w, just missed
